Text.Value: I know Jaheira. We're travelling together, in fact.
And I am confused. She is not with us at this very moment, no - but she's around the city somewhere.
Me, I don't think nature ever left. People lay down cobbles, aye, but seeds still sprout between the cracks.
Leave.
Why would this place need a druid? It's a house, in the middle of the city.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: This isn't important, I don't know why I've leaned into azalias so much, it's clearly self indulgent. Cull away

Text.Value: I am not sure why this is such sad news...? Your mother is with us! Not this very moment, no - Boo thinks she is probably shouting at a tree stump somewhere.

EditorData.NodeContext: Quizzical - doesn't understand that Jord thinks Jaheira is dead

Text.Value: I'll tend the sanctuary 'til the real druid is ready to return. Make sure that happens, eh? I'm still just an apprentice.
Go on. The longer you take, mother dear, the more of your plants will be dead when you get back.
Minsc? She's not... away. She's gone. I am sorry.
If you're here about the vines, I've cleared them off the neighbouring houses already.
Oh. I... took you for a friend of hers. The druid, Jaheira?
Who's your mother?
Minsc?
Bring mum back. It won't come to blows, whatever Rion says. Probably, it won't.
YES! Thank you. Meet my mother when she returns - put it that way, and you might just convince her.
You've come back at a... sad time, ranger. Jaheira's gone.
Wait - what? You know where mum is? Tell Rion - quickly!
If you need a druid, come back when my mother's returned. Could be a while, though.
Can't promise it'll be the last time. The druid's away for a while - I'm just her son. And apprentice too, for my sins.
Tell Rion about mother. Quickly!

EditorData.NodeContext: Restrained excitement - we've given him excellent news, he wants us to tell his sister.

Text.Value: Jord! I think this druidry suits you - you have grown taller than Minsc!
You think like my mother - that's why she keeps a small grove here. To 'return nature to the unnatural'.
Aha! Jaheira has left you some tasks while she was away, Jord?
What? You know where mum is? Tell Rion - quickly!
An urban grove is nothing strange. Life takes many forms, and nature is hardier than any stone walls.

Synopsis: Conversation with Jaheira's eldest son. Her children should combo to give the player just enough information to hang themselves with Re: why Jaheira's children are of vastly different ages (and in theory races)
